result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan Lori Dowdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAYMENT PLAN FOR THIS CASE IS $100 PER MONTH COMMENCING 5/30/15

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan Lori Dowdy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Susan Lori Dowdy in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided and the defendant would like to accept the offer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant agrees.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant would like to proceed without an Attorney.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200 surcharge
  Court advises defendant of DNA Sample requirement per statute.
Payment plan to be established with the COC office.

Defendant Susan Lori Dowdy in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant regarding further proceedings.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court approves the waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
